  • Element
Package org.greports.annotations

Annotation Type Configuration

@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(ANNOTATION_TYPE)
public @interface Configuration

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type Required Element Description
    java.lang.String[] reportName
    Defines a name of report which is used by the org.greports.engine to obtain this configuration.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
    boolean createHeader
    The value indicates if the header needs to be created.
    short dataStartColumnIndex
    Indicates on which column the data will start.
    short dataStartRowIndex
    Indicates on which row the data will start.
    short headerRowIndex
    Header's row index.
    short horizontalOffset
    Horizontal offset.
    java.lang.String locale
    Locale string representation.
    java.lang.String sheetName
    Sheet's name.
    boolean showGridlines
    A boolean indicating if the gridlines must be shown.
    boolean sortableHeader
    The value indicates if the header needs to be sortable.
    SpecialColumn[] specialColumns
    An array of SpecialColumn
    SpecialRow[] specialRows
    An array of SpecialRow
    boolean stickyHeader
    This value indicates if the header row needs t be sticky (freeze).
    boolean templatedInject
    Indicates if the configuration to be parsed need to be injected into existing sheet using TemplateDataInjector
    java.lang.String templatePath
    Template path to be used to generate the report.
    TranslationsParser.FileExtensions translationFileExtension
    Translation file extension.
    java.lang.String translationsDir
    Relative route to directory containing translations.
    short verticalOffset
    Vertical offset.

  • Element Details

    • reportName

      java.lang.String[] reportName
      Defines a name of report which is used by the org.greports.engine to obtain this configuration.
      Returns:
      String

    • translationsDir

      java.lang.String translationsDir
      Relative route to directory containing translations. This directory needs to be placed in resource folder of the project. Every translations file need to have the follow name: messages.[reportLang].(yml|yaml) Valid examples for .yml: i18n/messages.en.yml i18n/messages.es.yml i18n/messages.de.yml Valid example .yaml: i18n/messages.en.yaml i18n/messages.es.yaml i18n/messages.de.yaml
      Returns:
      String
      Default:
      "i18n/"

    • translationFileExtension

      TranslationsParser.FileExtensions translationFileExtension
      Translation file extension.
      Returns:
      TranslationsParser.FileExtensions
      Default:
      YML

    • locale

      java.lang.String locale
      Locale string representation.
      Returns:
      String
      Default:
      "en_US"

    • templatePath

      java.lang.String templatePath
      Template path to be used to generate the report. This template path needs to point the template inside the resource folder of the project.
      Returns:
      String
      Default:
      ""

    • sheetName

      java.lang.String sheetName
      Sheet's name. If value is empty, the org.greports.engine will generate the sheet's name automatically.
      Returns:
      String
      Default:
      ""

    • createHeader

      boolean createHeader
      The value indicates if the header needs to be created.
      Returns:
      boolean
      Default:
      true

    • stickyHeader

      boolean stickyHeader
      This value indicates if the header row needs t be sticky (freeze).
      Returns:
      boolean
      Default:
      false

    • sortableHeader

      boolean sortableHeader
      The value indicates if the header needs to be sortable.
      Returns:
      boolean
      Default:
      false

    • headerRowIndex

      short headerRowIndex
      Header's row index.
      Returns:
      short
      Default:
      0

    • dataStartRowIndex

      short dataStartRowIndex
      Indicates on which row the data will start. 0-based.
      Returns:
      short
      Default:
      1

    • dataStartColumnIndex

      short dataStartColumnIndex
      Indicates on which column the data will start. 0-based.
      Returns:
      short
      Default:
      0

    • templatedInject

      boolean templatedInject
      Indicates if the configuration to be parsed need to be injected into existing sheet using TemplateDataInjector
      Returns:
      boolean
      Default:
      false

    • verticalOffset

      short verticalOffset
      Vertical offset. When greater then zero, indicated quantity of rows will be skipped counting from first row (0 index). Applies as global offset. headerRowIndex, dataStartRowIndex and specialRows will consider the offset value.
      Example: (All row indexes are 0-based) 
           verticalOffset = 0, headerRowIndex = 1 => header starts at row 1
     verticalOffset = 1, headerRowIndex = 1 => header starts at row 2
     verticalOffset = 4, headerRowIndex = 0 => header starts at row 4
     verticalOffset = 4, headerRowIndex = 2 => header starts at row 6
      Returns:
      short
      Default:
      0

    • horizontalOffset

      short horizontalOffset
      Horizontal offset. When greater then zero, indicated quantity of columns will be skipped counting from first column (0 index). Applies as global offset. headerRowIndex, dataStartRowIndex and specialRows will consider the offset value.
      Example: (All column indexes are 0-based) 
           horizontalOffset = 0, headerRowIndex = 1 => header starts at column 0 (A)
     horizontalOffset = 1, headerRowIndex = 1 => header starts at column 1 (B)
     horizontalOffset = 4, headerRowIndex = 0 => header starts at column 4 (E)
     horizontalOffset = 4, headerRowIndex = 2 => header starts at column 4 (E)
      Returns:
      short
      Default:
      0

    • showGridlines

      boolean showGridlines
      A boolean indicating if the gridlines must be shown.
      Returns:
      boolean
      Default:
      true

    • specialRows

      SpecialRow[] specialRows
      An array of SpecialRow
      Returns:
      SpecialRow[]
      Default:
      {}

    • specialColumns

      SpecialColumn[] specialColumns
      An array of SpecialColumn
      Returns:
      SpecialColumn[]
      Default:
      {}
